turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Antella (fungus).
turn.1: What is known about Antella fungus?
turn.2: Antella (fungus) Antella is a genus of three species of crust fungi in the family Steccherinaceae.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The genus was circumscribed by Finnish mycologist Otto Miettinen in 2016 with "Antella niemelaei" as the type species.
turn.5: What were the other species classified under?
turn.6: All three species were formerly classified in the polyphyletic genus "Antrodiella".
turn.8: This is reflected in the name "Antella", which is a "construct of letters from the genus name "Antrodiella"." "Antella" species have light-coloured, crust-like fruit bodies with a poroid surface.
turn.9: What are some of the features of the fungus?
turn.10: They have a dimitic hyphal system, with both generative and skeletal hyphae, and clamp connections in the hyphae.
turn.12: The thin-walled spores are ellipsoid, measuring less than 4.5 by 2.5 μm.
